repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits

summary.p: A copy, commissioned by Édouard Ariel, of the Āṉantaraṅkakkōvai alias the Āṉantaraṅkaṉ Kōvai, a poem in the kōvai genre dedicated to Āṉantaraṅkappiḷḷai (1709-1761). 2 kāppu stanzas + 394 stanzas.

The work is attributed in the manuscript to Tiyākarāca Paṇṭāram, son of Vayittiyaṉāta Paṇṭāram (that is, Vaittiyanāta Tēcikar), the author the Ilakkaṇaviḷakkam in Tiruvārūr (see U1b, f1v, c2). See Zvelebil (1995, p. 703).
Description based on the examination of the original manuscript (January 2024).
Dimensions assessed at the time of examination.

support.p: The edges have been recut on the left and right sides of the leaves, possibly already at the time of Ariel. It could also have been done in two stages, one more recently as the leaves' edges are still light-coloured on one side.

collation.desc: 1 bifolio = Āṉantaraṅkakkōvai: Title Page (original). No foliation. Verso blank. 480 x 29 mm.
101 folios = Āṉantaraṅkakkōvai: Text. Tamil foliation 1-101. 481/482 x 27 mm.
1 folio = guard leaf. No foliation. Blank recto verso. 480 x 26 mm.

layoutDesc.layout: Tidy layout in columns, with intertitle and text alternating. 2 stanzas per page. Stanzas distributed aṭi-wise, with final letters indented to the left, when the aṭi is too short to fill in a full line. With verse numbering.

additions.desc: BnF shelfmark sticker: INDIEN 387 (front cover, recto), covering an older sticker.
BnF donation sticker DON N° (front cover, recto).
Shelfmark sticker (Société Asiatique?), written in black ink: 410 (f[1]r).
Usual blessings are found at different locations in the first 3 folios.
Intertitle in columns 1 and 3, as intertitles to stanzas in columns 2 and 4.

binding.p: Pinewood covers apparently fabricated in the BnF.

origin.origDate: Internally dated to the year cātāraṇa of the Jovian cycle, Sunday 18 of month of avaṇi, that is, 1st September 1st 1850 CE, according to Vinson. Correspondence is confirmed in Swamikannu Pillai, Indian Ephemeris (1800-2000 AD), p. 103. See colophon (U1b, f101v).

provenance.p: Copied for Édouard Ariel by an unnamed copyist, most probably in Pondicherry. See colophon (U1b, f101v). Bequeathed by Édouard Ariel to Société Asiatique (Rosny 1868, p. 177).

acquisition.p: Received, August 1st, 1866, from the Société Asiatique. — See BnF, Département des Manuscrits, Inventaire 7 = dons : manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1848-1895, n° 1 à 3306: no. 1192.

Cabaton, Antoine. 1912. Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See p. 56, no. 387.
Vinson, Julien & Feer, Léon & s.n. 1866-. Catalogue des manuscrits tamoul et télinga. Manuscript, BnF Indien 577. — See f. 90r, no. 361 387.
Zvelebil, Kamil V. 1995. Lexicon of Tamil Literature. Leiden [etc.]: Brill.

encodingDesc.p: General ― Unmarked length of ō and ē supplied. Unmarked puḷḷi supplied. Conjectural reading (text unclear) between parentheses. Supplied reading (text lost) between square brackets. Alternative readings separated by slash. In transliteration ― Unmarked elided overshort u supplied as an apostrophe. Uppercase for initial vowels. Symbols between curly brackets. Abbreviations ― c = column; f = folio; lf = library foliation; lm = left margin; r = recto; rm = right margin; u / U followed by a number = unit (codicological and/or textual); v = verso.
